translation: The Rudras, Adityas, Vasus, Sadhyas, Visvedevas, the two Asvins, Maruts, the Manus, and the hosts of celestial singers, Yakshas, demons, and the perfected ones, all look upon Thee with great amazement.
commentary: 11.22 Rudras and Adityas? Vasus Vasus? Ye these? f and? Sadhyas Sadhyas? Visvedevas in the world? Ashvins the two Asvins? Maruts Maruts? f and? Heat drinkers Pitris? f and? Gandharvayakshasurasiddhasanghas hosts of Gandharvas? Yakshas? Asuras and Siddhas? are looking at are looking at? You Thee? Astonished astonished? f and? Eve even? all all.Commentary Sadhyas are a class of gods of whom Brahma is the chief.Visvedevas
